content.description: The Priest And The Gun is a striking line facing east on a hidden corner crag on the northern slope of Sunset Peak’s ridge just south of HWY 49.Start on bomber cups and fist jams under a roof and work up to the point of the V. Turn the roof and do a secure grovel up the offwidth or an exposed and iffy feeling lieback to the top.BD3-7 and a red totem will get you up The Priest And The Gun. For anchor BD4-3 and purple and green totem will make a bomber anchor inline with the climb/edge to minimize rope drag.BD6 will be tippy if you don’t place them well. They can work perfectly if placed with care. BD7 would be easier to toss and go.Taller than it appears in photo.
content.protection: BD3-7, red totem. For anchor BD4/3/2 and green and purple totem

content.description: 13th Prayer sits 25’ right of The Priest And The Gun.Start beneath the large triangular roof and work up to one of the best kneebars in the Refuge.Say your prayers and fire off to turn the roof sequence.Enter a brief barfight of 5.11-5.12 climbing and then enjoy the shakeout before the linked moves to topout.The crux is very wingspan dependent but multiple Betas Go - some are just much more powerful than others. 75-76” AI will have a much easier time and anyone under 70” will have to really saddle up.Very rewarding to unlock the best sequence and an exciting climb!
content.protection: Regular nuts and finger cams. Rope built follow/swap anchor will be easier than block / TR style anchors. 30’ cordelette will get you started on a big boulder but lots of insecure rock makes TR anchor more difficult. Rope-built to better protection is best.
content.location: 13th Prayer faces east and sits 25’ right of The Priest And The Gun.(34.7399727, -98.7475372)

content.description: Yellow Snake Hotel And Saloon is located on the northern slope of Sunset Peak ridge and just a few minutes uphill from HWY 49. Park one parking pullout east of The Bird Trap or one parking pullout west of Western Bacon Steezburger parking where you can see Pear And Apple and Crab Eyes simultaneously.There are numerous highball lines to be done and a handful of harder trad climbs as well.  Catches shade in the afternoons so it’s a nice hideout from the heat. A hidden chimney room sits behind this main wall.130 years ago Beer City was a famous little tent town known for wild times in NW Oklahoma. Pussycat Nell owned the Yellow Snake Hotel And Saloon. m.okgazette.com/oklahoma/be…
